item.description:
Let's meet up for an evening of FREE classical music!

Sorry for the short notice folks, but I wasn't sure I was going to be in town for this; luckily I'll be returning earlier in the day, so I won't miss this!

The New England Conservatory has a series of FREE symphony orchestra concerts at Jordan Hall each Wednesday night during the fall. Please join me for the opening night! The hall is absolutely beautiful, and the acoustics are amazing. I will always try to sit in the left-middle balcony section, since it affords a good view of the orchestra, and any pianist's hands should there be one.

This evening's program will be performed by the NEC Philharmonia orchestra, and will be conducted by Hugh Wolff, the NEC's director of Orchestras. Here is the link to the event on the NEC website.

The concert starts at 8pm, but let's meet up at 7:30, so we have a chance to socialize before the concert.

FYI: To include my "social fun" regulars, I've also scheduled a pre-concert dinner at Pho and I on their calendar; please consider joining me for a quick bite before the concert. (Go to http://www.meetup.com... to sign up!)

/Will

Directions to Jordan Hall:
The hall is located at the corner of Huntington and Gainsborough streets, about a block south of the Symphony T stop on the Green Line. (The last time I was there, there was black canvas covering the side of the building and the sidewalk, as I believe the facade is under repair.)


This evening's program:

Brahms Symphony No. 3
Stravinsky's Rite of Spring
item.how_to_find_us: I will stand in the lobby until 7:45, after which I will move upstairs to the left-middle balcony section.
item.name: Classical Concert Series: NEC Opening Night
